title: Thunderbird constantly Hangs "Not Responding"
content:
I began using Thunderbird several weeks ago, beginning with the previous version and upgrading to the new one. From the beginning, Thunderbird hangs every couple of minutes, whether I'm navigating or composing a reply. It doesn't shut down, it just stops working, often with "Not Responding" in the title bar. It usually comes back within 5-10 seconds. It did this when I was in Troubleshoot mode.

I've seen suggestions to see what happens in Safe Mode. I hate using Safe Mode, so I'm hoping for another suggestion or test to do in regular mode before I go that route. Kami

Met vriendelijke groet,

title: slow loading of email content using POP3
content:
I use Thunderbird as an email client, and a POP3 connection to Virginmedia to download emails. This has worked pretty well for years. In the last few weeks the email content has been very slow to load. Although the list of emails in the inbox in Thunderbird appears quickly, when I select an email to view its content there is a delay of perhaps 5s while it says 'Loading Message...'. There is a similar delay when deleting a message.

Once a message has been loaded, it can be re-visited without a delay, but if marked as unread there is again a delay next time it is read. This is also true if I work offline, so it can't be Virginmedia's server.

I have another account using an IMAP connection which doesn't suffer from any delay. Thanks if anyone can advise.

title: How to fix the row height of messages and add space to the bottom?
content:
I just updated to the latest version of Thunderbird after not updating for well over a year now, so I'm late to the "hate on Thunderbird devs" party. The font changes, as I'm sure have been mentioned a million times, is a disaster. I've already wasted several hours on this.

I managed to fix the core font size issue with, which fixed MOST of the problems:

layout.css.devPixelsPerPx = 1.12

However, I can't figure out how to increase the row height of the message area. If I switch from Compact mode to Default, everything in the folder pane gets far too big (and, yes, I reset devPixelsPerPx as a test) and the message area rows are too tall.

In addition, I want a few pixels at the bottom of the message area so that when a new message comes in, I see a few pixels of the top of the new message without having to scroll.

If you are having trouble visualizing what I want:

Per row of each message: 1px padding at the top + 18px main area + 1px padding at the bottom (i.e. 20 px total). After the last row: 3px (or so) to display just enough pixels to show the next message whenever it arrives.

Using the browser toolbox, I see that the height of each row is defined using an inline style. So I can't apply CSS to fix it globally in a custom stylesheet. Using the Inspector, I can temporarily change the inline style of a single row to "height: 20px" and it displays the row as I want it to be displayed. However, this doesn't solve the other problem of putting a few pixels at the end of the messages to display a few pixels of a new message when it arrives. I also tried modifying the selector "table[is="tree-view-table"] & td" to hardcode a 20px height and added a 3px padding to the bottom, which works to solve BOTH problems BUT introduces a bug where switching folders no longer scrolls to the bottom of the list of messages. My guess is that Thunderbird is calculating where to scroll to based on the assumption that the row height is exactly 18px. So using CSS alone is not really possible.

What a mess.
creator: funnymonkeybanana+mozilla20240827

title: Thunderbird suddenly won't download any messages.
content: 2 weeks ago my Thunderbird stopped downloading my emails. I didn't discover it till my wife told me she wasn't getting any emails. On both laptop and my desktop we can send emails but not receive them. Both of our computers are windows 11. After trying to figure this out and nothing works I thought I would try opening same accounts in Blue Mail ( which I not a fan ). I entered all the pop3 info for my account and in minutes it retrieved the emails so it's not the server. On my wife's laptop I tried adding the exact same account (in Thunderbird) and it worked. She has 2 identical accounts and one gets the mail and the other one doesn't. I tried the same on my computer as a work around but Thunderbird won't let me, it says after all the info is entered " account already exists". There is a very similar forum entry from a few years back on here, but fortunately she could just click on each account and click "get mail" and it would download her messages. Mine won't. I use no add-ons and use default theme. I also deactivated the firewall and anti-virus, still nothing. I still find it strange that 2 separate computers have the exact same problem simultaneously. I'm upset because I've been using Thunderbird for many, many years. I think I started using it 20 years ago. Thanks

title: TBird v.128: Authentication of Office 365 organizational accounts broken
content:
I use TBird to access a 365 institutional ".edu" account-- at least I used to! Normally, when adding a new account or logging in to an existing account after a password update, TBird would access Microsoft online and proceed directly to the institutional site where I would enter my institutional credentials. That still works just fine on my TBird v.115 installation. With v.128, the process stops at a Microsoft online URL and pops up an authentication box requesting login credentials (see uploaded image). That is, the process halts before reaching the institutional page. Neither my Microsoft account credentials nor my institutional credentials work. Taking a look at the error log via the developer tools seems to indicates that the required functions have been deprecated.

Thanks for any insight!
creator: bell2200

title: Can't log into Google account‚ÄîGoogle says Javascript is disabled
content:
I changed my gmail password recently so had to re-authenticate for Thunderbird.

See the attached images. When I click "next" I get the error message about JavaScript being disabled.

No idea how to troubleshoot this or what might be causing this. Help would be appreciated. Thanks

title: Thunderbird password manager will not remember POP or SMTP password
content:
I came back home to Thunderbird after loosing my job that required me to use Outlook. Everything is fine except that when I start Thunderbird I am asked for the password for my SMTP server. Fine, that's what I expected, but if I check the box that says "Use Password Manager to remember this password" the password will not be remembered. I will be asked for the password next time I log on.

Any suggestions?

TIA!
creator: rjspann

title: email disappeared 2019-2024
content:
All my Thunderbird incoming emails from June 2019 -last week disappeared. My sent email is still there. I read that it is a not uncommon problem but I cannot understand all the Help Articles. I am 70 years old and can use a computer but do not understand how it works. Our IT consultant retired suddenly and I am urgently looking for a new one. I am in San Francisco.

I called Support at Sonic, They checked and updated my settings but they were not able to restore the incoming email.

Thanks for your attention.
creator: laura105

title: How to stop the popup windows from Thunderbird asking for Google access?
content:
If this has been asked previously, my sincerest apologies. I couldn't find the answer. I have been an user of Thunderbird for personal and work email clients for roughly 2+ decades now. But I am stumped with recent behavior coming from thunderbird (mozilla email) for my private, professional email account. And I'm not a techie. I usually allow both Mozilla Firefox and Thunderbird update automatically. And typically, there has been no issues other than to update/remove an add-in.

However, starting at around the end of July or beg of August, I have been seeing the following behavior: At certain points of the day including at startup, I get a set of pop-up windows from Thunderbird asking for access to my google account. I don't understand why thunderbird would want me to provide my google credentials when the email account that I'm using thunderbird for is neither an exchange (outlook.com or live.com) or my gmail.com account. It's my professional email address that is hosted by a third party. And when I click the deny button on both windows, it still pops up at some point during the day. It was annoying as 'heck' when I was with a client as it kept popping up. Don't know what I've done but I would like to know how to stop this popup window activity! I'll also add that if I close down thunderbird and then restart, the windows pop up almost instantly. So, any help would be welcome! I've attached screenshots of both windows with my email addresses highlighted out so anyone can see what I'm dealing with.
creator: teresab18

title: How to stop emails ending up in the Junk folder.
content: I have been receiving emails from "How to Geek" for many years. Now Thunderbird moves these emails to the Junk folder. I have already added & added again the email address to my contacts but it makes no difference.

title: Forgot Password

I'm hoping someone can guide me and it's an easy fix because on a computer literacy 1-10 scale, I'm 2.5.
